name: patient_id
description: Unique patient identifier

name: lcd_id
description: Local Coverage Determination ID

name: lcd_title
description: Local Coverage Determination Title

name: policy_topic
description: Main topic of the policy: Epidural Steroid Injections for Pain Management

name: effective_date_original
description: Original Effective Date for services performed

name: effective_date_revision
description: Revision Effective Date for services performed

name: patient_age_minimum_years
description: Minimum patient age in years (age >= 18)

name: patient_age_elderly_threshold_years
description: Patient age threshold for elderly considerations (65 and older)

name: patient_pregnancy_flag
description: Indicates if the patient is pregnant, in which case ultrasound guidance without contrast may be considered

name: diagnosis_radiculopathy_lumbar
description: Diagnosis of lumbar radiculopathy

name: diagnosis_radiculopathy_cervical
description: Diagnosis of cervical radiculopathy

name: diagnosis_radiculopathy_thoracic
description: Diagnosis of thoracic radiculopathy

name: diagnosis_radicular_pain
description: Diagnosis of radicular pain

name: diagnosis_neurogenic_claudication
description: Diagnosis of neurogenic claudication

name: diagnosis_disc_herniation
description: Diagnosis of disc herniation

name: diagnosis_osteophyte
description: Diagnosis of osteophyte

name: diagnosis_osteophyte_complex
description: Diagnosis of osteophyte complex

name: diagnosis_degenerative_disc_disease_severe
description: Diagnosis of severe degenerative disc disease

name: diagnosis_spinal_stenosis_foraminal
description: Diagnosis of foraminal spinal stenosis

name: diagnosis_spinal_stenosis_central
description: Diagnosis of central spinal stenosis

name: diagnosis_post_laminectomy_syndrome
description: Diagnosis of post-laminectomy syndrome

name: diagnosis_acute_herpes_zoster_associated_pain
description: Diagnosis of acute herpes zoster associated pain

name: diagnosis_acute_low_back_pain_duration_weeks
description: Acute low back pain defined as present for up to six weeks

name: diagnosis_cervicobrachialgia
description: Pain in the neck radiating to the arm, caused by compression of nerve roots of the cervical spine

name: diagnosis_discogenic_pain
description: Pain originating from damaged vertebral disc, particularly, but not always, due to degenerative disc disease

name: diagnosis_non_radicular_back_pain
description: Radiating non-neuropathic pain which is not causally related to a spinal nerve root irritation and does not produce reproducible neuropathic symptoms in an objective dermatomal pattern

name: diagnosis_nonspecific_low_back_pain
description: Back pain that cannot be attributed to a specific disease or spinal pathology

name: diagnosis_peripheral_neuropathic_pain
description: Pain causally related to a lesion or disease of the peripheral somatosensory nerves

name: diagnosis_radicular_back_pain
description: Nerve root pain radiating from the affected spinal segment in a distribution concordant with the known distribution of the nerve root

name: diagnosis_radiculopathy
description: Radiating neuropathic pain causally related to spinal nerve root irritation, extending distally, producing neuropathic pain in a myotomal or dermatomal pattern

name: diagnosis_radiculitis
description: Inflammation of the nerve roots producing radicular pain without objective neurological findings on physical examination

name: diagnosis_spinal_stenosis
description: Narrowing of the central spinal canal or foraminal openings, typically due to spinal degeneration, disc herniation, osteoarthritis, or tumor

name: diagnosis_spondylolisthesis
description: Disorder where one vertebra slips onto the vertebra below it, causing pain in lower back or legs

name: diagnosis_subacute_pain_duration_weeks
description: Pain occurring during the six to twelve-week time period

name: diagnosis_chronic_pain_duration_weeks
description: Pain occurring 12 weeks after the onset of the pain

name: diagnosis_nonspecific_low_back_pain_exclusion
description: ESIs to treat non-specific low back pain (LBP) are considered investigational and not medically reasonable and necessary

name: diagnosis_axial_spine_pain_exclusion
description: ESIs to treat axial spine pain are considered investigational and not medically reasonable and necessary

name: diagnosis_complex_regional_pain_syndrome_exclusion
description: ESIs to treat complex regional pain syndrome are considered investigational and not medically reasonable and necessary

name: diagnosis_widespread_diffuse_pain_exclusion
description: ESIs to treat widespread diffuse pain are considered investigational and not medically reasonable and necessary

name: diagnosis_neuropathy_pain_exclusion
description: ESIs to treat pain from neuropathy from other causes are considered investigational and not medically reasonable and necessary

name: diagnosis_cervicogenic_headaches_exclusion
description: ESIs to treat cervicogenic headaches are considered investigational and not medically reasonable and necessary

name: procedure_epidural_steroid_injection
description: Medical procedure involving the administration of a solution containing corticosteroids and/or anesthetic into the epidural space for pain management

name: procedure_interlaminar_epidural_steroid_injection
description: Injection of contrast (absent allergy), then corticosteroid and possibly local anesthetic into the epidural space via paramedian or midline interlaminar approach under fluoroscopic guidance

name: procedure_transforaminal_epidural_steroid_injection
description: Epidural injection via paramedian approach into intervertebral foramen to inject near dorsal root ganglion and exiting spinal nerve root (previously selective nerve root block)

name: procedure_caudal_epidural_steroid_injection
description: Administration of contrast (absent allergy), then corticosteroids and possibly local anesthetic into the epidural space via sacral hiatus under fluoroscopic guidance

name: procedure_image_guidance_CT
description: Epidural steroid injections must be performed under CT image guidance with contrast, unless contraindicated

name: procedure_image_guidance_fluoroscopy
description: Epidural steroid injections must be performed under fluoroscopy image guidance with contrast, unless contraindicated

name: procedure_image_guidance_ultrasound
description: Ultrasound guidance without contrast may be considered for epidural steroid injections if patient has documented allergy to contrast or is pregnant

name: procedure_transforaminal_epidural_steroid_injection_max_levels_per_region
description: Maximum of two (2) levels for Transforaminal Epidural Steroid Injections (TFESIs) in one spinal region

name: procedure_caudal_epidural_steroid_injection_max_levels
description: Maximum of one level for Caudal Epidural Steroid Injections (CESIs)

name: procedure_interlaminar_epidural_steroid_injection_max_levels
description: Maximum of one level for Interlaminar Epidural Steroid Injections (ILESIs)

name: procedure_transforaminal_epidural_steroid_injection_bilateral_flag
description: Transforaminal Epidural Steroid Injections (TFESIs) may be performed bilaterally only when clinically indicated

name: procedure_repeat_ESI_minimum_interval_days
description: If initial ESI fails, a repeat ESI can be performed after 14 days

name: procedure_image_guidance_required_flag
description: Injections performed without image guidance or by ultrasound are generally not considered reasonable and necessary, with exceptions for contraindications to contrast

name: procedure_multiple_blocks_same_session_flag
description: Performing multiple blocks (ESI, sympathetic blocks, facet blocks, trigger point injections) during the same session as ESIs is generally not medically reasonable and necessary, with the exception of a facet synovial cyst and ESI

name: procedure_sedation_level
description: Use of Moderate or Deep Sedation, General Anesthesia, and Monitored Anesthesia Care (MAC) is usually unnecessary or rarely indicated for ESI procedures; oral anxiolytics typically suffice

name: procedure_ESI_max_sessions_per_region_12_months
description: ESIs are limited to a maximum of four (4) sessions per spinal region in a rolling twelve (12) month period

name: procedure_ESI_max_spinal_regions_per_session
description: Not medically reasonable and necessary for more than one spinal region to be injected in the same session

name: procedure_TFESI_max_nerve_root_levels_per_session
description: Not medically reasonable and necessary to perform TFESIs at more than two (2) nerve root levels during the same session

name: procedure_caudal_epidural_steroid_injection_interlaminar_epidural_steroid_injection_max_levels_per_session
description: Not medically reasonable and necessary to perform CESIs or ILESIs at more than one (1) level during the same session

name: procedure_caudal_epidural_steroid_injection_bilateral_flag
description: Not medically reasonable and necessary to perform CESIs bilaterally

name: procedure_interlaminar_epidural_steroid_injection_bilateral_flag
description: Not medically reasonable and necessary to perform ILESIs bilaterally

name: procedure_predetermined_ESI_series_flag
description: Not medically reasonable and necessary to prescribe a predetermined series of ESIs

name: procedure_ESI_max_duration_months
description: Treatment with ESI generally not considered medically reasonable and necessary beyond 12 months

name: procedure_imaging_MRI_lumbar
description: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the lumbar spine without contrast classified as 'usually appropriate' for diagnostics

name: procedure_imaging_CT
description: Computed tomography (CT) classified as 'appropriate' if MRI is unavailable for diagnostics

name: procedure_selective_nerve_root_block
description: Diagnostic injection of contrast (absent allergy) of a single nerve root with local anesthetic, inserted into neuroforamen under fluoroscopic or CT guidance

name: procedure_ESI_SSNB_max_count_6_months
description: No more than 4 ESIs and/or SSNBs should be performed in a 6-month period of time

name: procedure_ESI_SSNB_max_count_12_months
description: No more than 6 ESIs and/or SSNBs should be performed in a 12-month period of time, regardless of the number of levels

name: procedure_TFESI_max_count_per_session
description: No more than 2 TFESIs should be performed at a single setting (e.g., single level bilaterally or two levels)

name: procedure_caudal_epidural_steroid_injection_interlaminar_epidural_steroid_injection_conjunction_with_TFESI_flag
description: For CESIs or ILESIs, only one level per session may be performed and NOT in conjunction with a TFESI injection

name: procedure_cervical_interlaminar_lumbar_transforaminal_volume_mL
description: Recommended to limit cervical interlaminar and lumbar transforaminal injection volume to 4mL

name: substance_corticosteroid
description: Corticosteroid medication used in epidural injections

name: substance_anesthetic
description: Anesthetic medication used in epidural injections

name: substance_saline
description: Saline solution used in epidural injections

name: substance_contrast_media
description: Contrast medium required for image guidance to confirm epidural placement, unless patient has a contraindication to contrast

name: substance_corticosteroid_injection
description: Corticosteroids should be included in subsequent epidural steroid injections

name: substance_anesthetic_injection
description: Anesthetics may be combined with corticosteroids in epidural steroid injections

name: substance_saline_injection
description: Saline may be combined with corticosteroids in epidural steroid injections

name: substance_biologicals_FDA_designation_flag
description: ESIs performed with biologicals or other substances not FDA designated for this use are considered investigational

name: substance_triamcinolone_max_dose_mg_per_session
description: Recommended not to exceed 80 mg of triamcinolone per session

name: substance_betamethasone_max_dose_mg_per_session
description: Recommended not to exceed 12 mg of betamethasone per session

name: substance_dexamethasone_max_dose_mg_per_session
description: Recommended not to exceed 15 mg of dexamethasone per session

name: substance_methylprednisolone_acetate_max_dose_mg
description: Recommended lowest effective dosing for methylprednisolone acetate (MPA) is 40mg

name: substance_triamcinolone_acetate_max_dose_mg_range_min
description: Recommended lowest effective dosing for triamcinolone acetate: 10mg

name: substance_triamcinolone_acetate_max_dose_mg_range_max
description: Recommended lowest effective dosing for triamcinolone acetate: 20mg

name: substance_dexamethasone_phosphate_max_dose_mg
description: Recommended lowest effective dosing for dexamethasone phosphate is 10mg (10mg/mL)

name: substance_etanercept_FDA_approval_flag
description: Etanercept is not FDA approved for injection into the epidural space

name: pain_scale_baseline_required_flag
description: Objective pain scale must be performed at baseline (prior to interventions)

name: functional_assessment_baseline_required_flag
description: Functional assessment must be performed at baseline (prior to interventions)

name: pain_scale_followup_required_flag
description: Same objective pain scale must be repeated at each follow-up for assessment of response

name: functional_assessment_followup_required_flag
description: Same functional assessment must be repeated at each follow-up for assessment of response

name: pain_duration_minimum_weeks
description: Minimum pain duration of at least four (4) weeks required before ESI consideration

name: conservative_care_intolerance_flag
description: Indicates inability to tolerate noninvasive conservative care

name: conservative_care_failure_duration_weeks
description: Medical documentation of failure to respond to four (4) weeks of noninvasive conservative care

name: diagnosis_acute_herpes_zoster_refractory_flag
description: Indicates if acute herpes zoster is refractory to conservative management, where a four (4) week wait is not required

name: conservative_treatment_conjunction_flag
description: Epidural steroid injections should be performed in conjunction with conservative treatments

name: rehabilitation_program_participation_flag
description: Patient should be part of an active rehabilitation program, home exercise program or functional restoration program

name: procedure_ESI_continuation_beyond_12_months_criteria
description: Criteria required for continuation of ESIs beyond 12 months: severe functional/vocational disability, at least 50% sustained improvement, rationale for continuation, and PCP notification

name: treatment_conservative_therapy
description: Appropriate combination of medication (NSAIDs, analgesics), physical therapy, spinal manipulation therapy, cognitive behavioral therapy, home exercise program, or other interventions

name: program_multidisciplinary_biopsychosocial_rehabilitation
description: Multidisciplinary biopsychosocial rehabilitation program targeting physical, psychological, and social aspects of LBP, involving a team of healthcare providers

name: conservative_management_failure_duration_weeks
description: Imaging may be considered for patients with no improvement in back pain after six weeks of medical management and physical therapy

name: procedure_repeat_ESI_pain_improvement_threshold
description: Minimum 50% sustained improvement in pain relief required for repeat ESI

name: procedure_repeat_ESI_function_improvement_threshold
description: Minimum 50% objective improvement in function required for repeat ESI

name: procedure_repeat_ESI_sustained_improvement_months
description: Minimum duration of sustained improvement (3 months) required for repeat ESI

name: pain_assessment_scale_types
description: Acceptable scales for pain assessment including verbal rating scales, Numerical Rating Scale (NRS), Visual Analog Scale (VAS)

name: disability_assessment_scale_types
description: Acceptable scales for disability assessment including Pain Disability Assessment Scale (PDAS), Oswestry Disability Index (ODI), Oswestry Low Back Pain Disability Questionnaire (OSW), Quebec Back Pain Disability Scale (QUE), Roland Morris Pain Scale, Back Pain Functional Scale (BPFS), PROMIS profile domains

name: treatment_success_pain_reduction_threshold
description: Threshold for significant pain relief for treatment success (e.g., 50% improvement from baseline)

name: treatment_success_function_improvement_threshold
description: Threshold for improvement in function for treatment success (e.g., 50% improvement from baseline)

name: pain_score_meaningful_change_threshold
description: A minimum of 20% change in pain scores is clinically meaningful

name: patient_contrast_allergy_flag
description: Indicates if the patient has a documented allergy to low molecular weight nonionic contrast

name: contraindication_spinal_infection
description: Contraindication for ESIs: suspected or active localized spinal infection

name: contraindication_systemic_infection
description: Contraindication for ESIs: significant systemic infection

name: contraindication_spinal_cord_compression
description: Contraindication for ESIs: compressive lesions of the spinal cord

name: contraindication_conus_medullaris_compression
description: Contraindication for ESIs: compressive lesions of the conus medullaris

name: contraindication_cauda_equina_compression
description: Contraindication for ESIs: compressive lesions of the cauda equina

name: contraindication_cancer_suspicion
description: Contraindication for ESIs: suspicion or major risk factors for cancer

name: contraindication_coagulopathy
description: Absolute contraindication: coagulopathy not correctible

name: contraindication_systemic_infection_concurrent
description: Absolute contraindication: concurrent systemic infection

name: contraindication_infectious_spondylitis
description: Absolute contraindication: infectious spondylitis

name: contraindication_acute_spinal_cord_compression
description: Absolute contraindication: acute spinal cord compression

name: contraindication_myelopathy
description: Absolute contraindication: myelopathy

name: contraindication_cauda_equina_syndrome_absolute
description: Absolute contraindication: cauda equina syndrome

name: contraindication_informed_consent_inability
description: Absolute contraindication: inability to obtain informed consent

name: contraindication_skin_puncture_infection
description: Absolute contraindication: infection at the skin puncture site

name: contraindication_anticoagulation_uncorrected
description: Relative contraindication: uncorrected anticoagulation therapy

name: contraindication_hypersensitivity_agents
description: Relative contraindication: hypersensitivity to administered agents

name: contraindication_pregnancy_relative
description: Relative contraindication: pregnancy (though interventions may be performed without image guidance)

name: contraindication_hepatitis
description: Relative contraindication: hepatitis (thrombocytopenia must be excluded)

name: contraindication_diabetes_uncontrolled
description: Relative contraindication: uncontrolled diabetes mellitus (risk of elevated blood sugars after steroid injections)

name: contraindication_congestive_heart_failure
description: Relative contraindication: congestive heart failure (steroid may lead to fluid retention)

name: contraindication_immunosuppressed_state
description: Relative contraindication: immunosuppressed state (preprocedural antibiotics may be considered)

name: contraindication_patient_improving_on_therapy
description: Relative contraindication: patient improving on medical and physical therapy

name: contraindication_severe_spinal_canal_stenosis
description: Relative contraindication: severe spinal canal stenosis

name: contraindication_no_response_previous_ESI
description: Relative contraindication: no response to previous well-performed ESI

name: contraindication_steroid_therapy_complication
description: Relative contraindication: complication to steroid therapy (Cushing’s etc.)

name: risk_fracture_per_ESI
description: Each successive injection increased the fracture risk by a factor of 1.21 (21% increased risk)

name: adverse_event_HPA_axis_suppression
description: Suppression of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis can occur after ESI, lasting three to six weeks

name: adverse_event_cushing_syndrome
description: Cushing syndrome is a rare adverse event after ESI

name: adverse_event_hyperglycemia_diabetes
description: Elevated glucose levels in diabetic patients may be seen for two to six days after ESI

name: adverse_event_immune_suppression
description: Dose-dependent suppression of the immune system has been reported after ESI

name: adverse_event_vaccine_effectiveness_reduction
description: Corticosteroids reduced the effectiveness of the vaccine

name: adverse_event_influenza_risk
description: Patients were at increased risk for developing influenza after a major joint injection with corticosteroids

name: adverse_event_vasovagal_reaction_rate
description: Most common adverse event reported: vasovagal reaction in 1.2% of procedures

name: adverse_event_dural_puncture_rate
description: Adverse event reported: dural punctures occurred in 0.06% of procedures

name: adverse_event_central_steroid_response_rate
description: Adverse event reported: central steroid response (sleeplessness, flushing, non-positional headache) in 2.6% of TFESI and ILESI patients

name: adverse_event_increased_pain_rate
description: Adverse event reported: increased pain in 2.1% of TFESI and 1.8% of ILESI patients

name: adverse_event_intravascular_penetration_rate
description: Adverse event reported: overall intravascular penetration rate of 4.3%

name: adverse_event_local_bleeding_rate
description: Adverse event reported: local bleeding rate of 63%

name: adverse_event_post_lumbar_puncture_headache_rate
description: Adverse event reported: post-lumbar puncture headache rate of 0.05%

name: adverse_event_transient_nerve_irritation_rate
description: Adverse event reported: transient nerve irritation rate of 0.85%

name: adverse_event_transient_spinal_cord_irritation_rate
description: Adverse event reported: transient spinal cord irritation rate of 0.08%

name: provider_training_requirements
description: Services considered medically reasonable and necessary only if performed by appropriately trained providers

name: provider_credentialing_requirements
description: Credentialing or privileges are required for procedures performed in inpatient and outpatient settings

name: provider_licensure_scope_of_practice
description: All aspects of care must be within the provider’s medical licensure and scope of practice

name: provider_imaging_modality_training
description: Providers must meet training requirements for using and interpreting imaging modalities (ionizing radiation and associated contrast material, magnetic resonance imaging, ultrasound)

name: definition_disability
description: Activity limitations and/or participation restrictions in an individual with a health condition, disorder or disease

name: definition_impairment
description: A significant deviation, loss, or loss of use of any body structure or body function in an individual with a health condition, disorder, or disease

name: definition_session
description: A time period that includes all procedures performed during one day

name: anatomy_spinal_levels
description: Spinal roots entering and exiting between vertebral segments: cervical (C1-C8), thoracic (T1-T2), lumbar (L1-L5), and Sacral (S1-S5)

name: anatomy_neural_foramina
description: Openings between each pair of vertebra (intervertebral foramen) where structures pass through
